hero.subheadline: Real-time operational resilience platform with automated intelligence that helps financial entities proactively manage IT and operational risks.

feature1.title: Unified Observability
feature1.description: Complete visibility across your entire IT infrastructure and operational landscape in real-time for enhanced resilience.

feature2.title: AI-Powered Intelligence
feature2.description: Predictive analytics and anomaly detection to identify IT risks and vulnerabilities before they impact your business operations.

feature3.title: Collaborative Resolution
feature3.description: Break down silos and enable IT, security, compliance, and business teams to work together on a single platform for faster, more effective risk resolution.

feature4.title: Automated Compliance
feature4.description: Built-in compliance assurance with automatic evidence generation, IT risk management documentation, and regulatory reporting.

problem.subheadline: Financial entities must demonstrate robust IT risk management, incident response capabilities, and operational resilience to meet evolving regulatory requirements and protect their business.

stat1.title: Critical IT Incidents
stat1.description: Financial entities experience severe disruptions from IT failures, cyber threats, and third-party dependencies that compromise service delivery.
stat1.label: Maximum penalties of global turnover for regulatory non-compliance

stat2.title: Third-Party IT Dependencies
stat2.description: Comprehensive oversight of IT third-party service providers creates complex monitoring obligations.
stat2.label: Of financial entities rely on critical third-party IT services

stat3.title: Manual Resilience Testing
stat3.description: Traditional approaches to IT resilience testing consume massive resources while failing to meet continuous monitoring requirements.
stat3.label: Person-hours spent annually on IT risk assessments and testing

stat4.title: Fragmented IT Risk Management
stat4.description: Financial institutions struggle with siloed IT risk data and disconnected teams, making it nearly impossible to maintain an integrated risk management framework or collaborate effectively on solutions.
stat4.label: Of IT incidents escalate due to delayed detection and poor cross-team coordination

solution.subheadline: The unified platform for operational resilience, real-time IT risk intelligence, and automated regulatory assurance.

feature1.title: Proactive IT Risk Prevention
feature1.description: Shift from reactive incident response to proactive IT risk management with real-time observability and AI-driven threat detection.

feature2.title: Enterprise-Ready Architecture
feature2.description: Purpose-built to address comprehensive IT risk management, incident reporting, resilience testing, third-party monitoring, and cross-functional team collaboration.

feature3.title: Unified Collaboration Hub
feature3.description: Bring together IT operations, security teams, compliance officers, and business stakeholders on one platform to resolve issues faster with shared context and visibility.

feature4.title: Automated Compliance Documentation
feature4.description: Dramatically reduce regulatory burden with automated evidence generation, continuous control monitoring, and audit-ready reporting.

feature5.title: AI-Powered Resilience
feature5.description: Leverage machine learning for advanced anomaly detection, pattern recognition, and predictive analytics to identify IT vulnerabilities before they cause disruptions.

mockup.footer2: Risk Scores, Compliance Status, IT Incidents

pillars.subheadline: Our platform provides three integrated capabilities that deliver comprehensive IT risk management and operational resilience—with built-in collaboration tools that unite cross-functional teams around shared goals.

pillar1.title: Unified Observability Engine
pillar1.description: Complete IT Risk Management - Ingest and correlate logs, metrics, and traces across your entire IT infrastructure for complete visibility.
pillar1.feature1: Comprehensive IT asset inventory and classification

pillar2.title: AI-Powered Risk Intelligence
pillar2.description: Intelligent Incident Management - Leverage machine learning for advanced threat detection and predictive analytics to identify and prevent IT-related incidents.

pillar3.title: Automated Compliance Assurance
pillar3.description: Continuous Resilience Testing & Reporting - Map operational events to regulatory requirements and automatically generate comprehensive compliance evidence and reports.

benefits.subheadline: Theodora delivers tangible results for financial entities, with proven resilience improvements and compliance efficiency.

stat1.title: Faster Incident Detection
stat1.description: Identify and classify major IT incidents in real-time

stat2.title: Compliance Automation
stat2.description: Reduce manual effort for documentation and reporting

stat3.title: Infrastructure Resilience
stat3.description: Maintain operational continuity with proactive monitoring

stat4.title: Risk Reduction
stat4.description: Prevent IT-related incidents through predictive intelligence

stat5.title: Faster Resolution
stat5.description: Resolve incidents faster with cross-functional collaboration

realResults.title: Real Results for Financial Entities
realResults.description: Theodora helps financial institutions achieve regulatory compliance while strengthening operational resilience.

case1.title: Accelerated Compliance Readiness
case1.description: A bank achieved full regulatory compliance ahead of deadlines by implementing automated IT risk management, continuous monitoring, and integrated third-party oversight—reducing compliance preparation costs by 68%.

case2.title: Streamlined Incident Reporting
case2.description: A payment services provider automated major incident classification and reporting workflows, reducing regulatory reporting time from 4 hours to 15 minutes while ensuring consistent compliance. By enabling real-time collaboration between their operations, security, and compliance teams on a unified platform, they reduced mean time to resolution by 55%.

case3.title: Enhanced Resilience Testing
case3.description: An investment firm transformed its resilience testing program with continuous automated testing and scenario analysis, reducing annual testing costs by 71% while exceeding regulatory requirements. Cross-functional visibility allowed business, IT, and risk teams to align on priorities and coordinate responses more effectively.

capability2.title: Incident Management & Reporting
capability2.feature6: Shared incident timeline and context for all stakeholders

trust.subheadline: Security and trust are at the core of everything we do. Theodora is designed with financial-grade security from the ground up.

feature1.title: Enterprise-Grade Security
feature1.description: Built with security-first design, encryption at rest and in transit, and comprehensive audit trails.

feature2.title: Data Protection
feature2.description: Your data is protected with industry-leading security measures and access controls.

feature3.title: Compliance Ready
feature3.description: Theodora helps you maintain compliance with major regulatory frameworks and standards.

cta.title: Ready to discuss securing your financial operations?
cta.description: Start a conversation to see how Theodora can help you prevent risks and automate compliance.

finalCta.subheadline: Theodora provides the comprehensive platform financial entities need to meet regulatory requirements while building genuine operational resilience.

footer.description: Real-time operational risk intelligence and automated compliance assurance for financial institutions.

section1.title: 1. Introduction
section1.paragraph1: Welcome to Theodora ("we", "us", "our"). We are committed to protecting the privacy of our users ("you", "your"). This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you visit our website {websiteUrl} and use our operational risk intelligence and automated compliance platform (the "Service"). Please read this privacy policy carefully. If you do not agree with the terms of this privacy policy, please do not access the site or use our Services.
section1.paragraph2: We reserve the right to make changes to this Privacy Policy at any time and for any reason. We will alert you about any changes by updating the "Effective Date" of this Privacy Policy.

section2.title: 2. Collection of Your Information
section2.intro: We may collect information about you in a variety of ways. The information we may collect via the Service includes:

item1.title: Personal Data:
item1.description: Personally identifiable information, such as your name, email address, phone number, job title, and company name, that you voluntarily give to us when you register with the Service or when you choose to participate in various activities related to the Service, such as requesting a demo or contacting us.

item2.title: Derivative Data:
item2.description: Information our servers automatically collect when you access the Service, such as your IP address, your browser type, your operating system, your access times, and the pages you have viewed directly before and after accessing the Service.

item3.title: Financial Data:
item3.description: We do not collect financial information directly. If payments are required for the Service, they will be processed through a secure third-party payment processor.

item4.title: Platform Usage Data:
item4.description: Information about how you use the Theodora platform, including interactions with features, settings, and operational data (anonymized or aggregated where possible).

item5.title: Cookies and Tracking Technologies:
item5.description: We may use cookies, web beacons, tracking pixels, and other tracking technologies on the Service to help customize the Service and improve your experience. Please refer to our Cookie Policy for more details.

section3.title: 3. Use of Your Information
section3.intro: Having accurate information about you permits us to provide you with a smooth, efficient, and customized experience. Specifically, we may use information collected about you via the Service to:
section3.item3: Process transactions and send related information, including purchase confirmations and invoices.
section3.item4: Communicate with you about your account or the Service, including responding to your comments, questions, and requests; provide customer service and support.
section3.item5: Send you administrative, technical, or marketing communications.
section3.item6: Monitor and analyze usage and trends to improve your experience with the Service.
section3.item7: Enhance the functionality and security of our Service, including fraud prevention.
section3.item8: Comply with applicable legal and regulatory requirements.
section3.item9: Perform other business activities as needed.

section4.title: 4. Disclosure of Your Information
section4.intro: We may share information we have collected about you in certain situations. Your information may be disclosed as follows:

item1.title: By Law or to Protect Rights:
item1.description: If we believe the release of information about you is necessary to respond to legal process, to investigate or remedy potential violations of our policies, or to protect the rights, property, and safety of others, we may share your information as permitted or required by any applicable law, rule, or regulation.

item2.title: Third-Party Service Providers:
item2.description: We may share your information with third parties that perform services for us or on our behalf, including payment processing, data analysis, email delivery, hosting services, customer service, and marketing assistance.

item3.title: Business Transfers:
item3.description: We may share or transfer your information in connection with, or during negotiations of, any merger, sale of company assets, financing, or acquisition of all or a portion of our business to another company.

item4.title: With Your Consent:
item4.description: We may disclose your personal information for any other purpose with your consent.

section5.title: 5. Security of Your Information
section5.paragraph1: We use administrative, technical, and physical security measures to help protect your personal information. While we have taken reasonable steps to secure the personal information you provide to us, please be aware that despite our efforts, no security measures are perfect or impenetrable, and no method of data transmission can be guaranteed against any interception or other type of misuse.

section6.title: 6. Data Retention
section6.paragraph1: We will only keep your personal information for as long as it is necessary for the purposes set out in this privacy policy, unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law (such as tax, accounting, or other legal requirements).

section7.title: 7. Your Privacy Rights
section7.intro: Depending on your location, you may have certain rights regarding your personal information, such as:
section7.item1: The right to access – You have the right to request copies of your personal data.
section7.item2: The right to rectification – You have the right to request that we correct any information you believe is inaccurate or incomplete.
section7.item3: The right to erasure – You have the right to request that we erase your personal data, under certain conditions.
section7.item4: The right to restrict processing – You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.
section7.item5: The right to object to processing – You have the right to object to our processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.
section7.item6: The right to data portability – You have the right to request that we transfer the data that we have collected to another organization, or directly to you, under certain conditions.
section7.outro: If you would like to exercise any of these rights, please contact us using the contact information provided below.

section8.title: 8. Policy for Children
section8.paragraph1: We do not knowingly solicit information from or market to children under the age of 13 (or the applicable age in your jurisdiction). If you become aware of any data we have collected from children under that age, please contact us.

section9.title: 9. International Transfers
section9.paragraph1: Your information, including personal information, may be transferred to — and maintained on — computers located outside of your state, province, country or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may differ from those of your jurisdiction. We will take all steps reasonably necessary to ensure that your data is treated securely and in accordance with this Privacy Policy.

section10.title: 10. Contact Us
section10.intro: If you have questions or comments about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:

section1.title: 1. Agreement to Terms
section1.paragraph1: These Terms of Service constitute a legally binding agreement made between you, whether personally or on behalf of an entity ("you") and Theodora ("we," "us," or "our"), concerning your access to and use of the {websiteUrl} website as well as any other media form, media channel, mobile website or mobile application related, linked, or otherwise connected thereto (collectively, the "Site") and our operational risk intelligence and automated compliance platform (the "Service").
section1.paragraph2: You agree that by accessing the Site and/or the Service, you have read, understood, and agreed to be bound by all of these Terms of Service. If you do not agree with all of these Terms of Service, then you are expressly prohibited from using the Site and the Service and you must discontinue use immediately.
section1.paragraph3: Supplemental terms and conditions or documents that may be posted on the Site or Service from time to time are hereby expressly incorporated herein by reference. We reserve the right, in our sole discretion, to make changes or modifications to these Terms of Service at any time and for any reason.

section2.title: 2. Service Description
section2.paragraph1: Theodora provides an operational risk intelligence platform designed for financial institutions. Our Service offers tools for risk assessment, compliance monitoring, automated reporting, and incident management to help organizations manage operational risks and meet regulatory requirements.

section3.title: 3. User Eligibility and Account
section3.paragraph1: The Service is intended for users who are at least 18 years old. Persons under the age of 18 are not permitted to use or register for the Service.
section3.paragraph2: You may be required to register with the Service. You agree to keep your password confidential and will be responsible for all use of your account and password. We reserve the right to remove, reclaim, or change a username you select if we determine, in our sole discretion, that such username is inappropriate, obscene, or otherwise objectionable.

section4.title: 4. User Representations
section4.intro: By using the Service, you represent and warrant that:
section4.item1: All registration information you submit will be true, accurate, current, and complete;
section4.item2: You will maintain the accuracy of such information and promptly update such registration information as necessary;
section4.item3: You have the legal capacity and you agree to comply with these Terms of Service;
section4.item4: You will not access the Service through automated or non-human means, whether through a bot, script, or otherwise;
section4.item5: You will not use the Service for any illegal or unauthorized purpose;
section4.item6: Your use of the Service will not violate any applicable law or regulation.

section5.title: 5. Prohibited Activities
section5.intro: You may not access or use the Service for any purpose other than that for which we make the Service available. The Service may not be used in connection with any commercial endeavors except those that are specifically endorsed or approved by us. As a user of the Service, you agree not to:
section5.item1: Systematically retrieve data or other content from the Service to create or compile, directly or indirectly, a collection, compilation, database, or directory without written permission from us.
section5.item2: Make any unauthorized use of the Service, including collecting usernames and/or email addresses of users by electronic or other means for the purpose of sending unsolicited email, or creating user accounts by automated means or under false pretenses.
section5.item3: Circumvent, disable, or otherwise interfere with security-related features of the Service.
section5.item4: Engage in unauthorized framing of or linking to the Service.
section5.item5: Trick, defraud, or mislead us and other users, especially in any attempt to learn sensitive account information such as user passwords.
section5.item6: Interfere with, disrupt, or create an undue burden on the Service or the networks or services connected to the Service.
section5.item7: Use any information obtained from the Service in order to harass, abuse, or harm another person.
section5.item8: Use the Service as part of any effort to compete with us or otherwise use the Service and/or the Content for any revenue-generating endeavor or commercial enterprise.
section5.item9: Decipher, decompile, disassemble, or reverse engineer any of the software comprising or in any way making up a part of the Service.
section5.item10: Harass, annoy, intimidate, or threaten any of our employees or agents engaged in providing any portion of the Service to you.
section5.item11: Upload or transmit (or attempt to upload or to transmit) viruses, Trojan horses, or other material that interferes with any party's uninterrupted use and enjoyment of the Service or modifies, impairs, disrupts, alters, or interferes with the use, features, functions, operation, or maintenance of the Service.
section5.item12: Use the Service in a manner inconsistent with any applicable laws or regulations.

section6.title: 6. Intellectual Property Rights
section6.paragraph1: Unless otherwise indicated, the Service is our proprietary property and all source code, databases, functionality, software, website designs, audio, video, text, photographs, and graphics on the Site and the Service (collectively, the "Content") and the trademarks, service marks, and logos contained therein (the "Marks") are owned or controlled by us or licensed to us, and are protected by copyright and trademark laws and various other intellectual property rights.

section7.title: 7. Term and Termination
section7.paragraph1: These Terms of Service shall remain in full force and effect while you use the Service. Without limiting any other provision of these terms, we reserve the right to, in our sole discretion and without notice or liability, deny access to and use of the service (including blocking certain ip addresses), to any person for any reason or for no reason.

section8.title: 8. Modifications and Interruptions
section8.paragraph1: We reserve the right to change, modify, or remove the contents of the Service at any time or for any reason at our sole discretion without notice. We also reserve the right to modify or discontinue all or part of the Service without notice at any time.
section8.paragraph2: We cannot guarantee the Service will be available at all times. We may experience hardware, software, or other problems or need to perform maintenance related to the Service, resulting in interruptions, delays, or errors. We reserve the right to change, revise, update, suspend, discontinue, or otherwise modify the Service at any time or for any reason without notice to you.

section9.title: 9. Governing Law
section9.paragraph1: These Terms of Service and your use of the Service are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of {jurisdiction}, applicable to agreements made and to be entirely performed within {jurisdiction}, without regard to its conflict of law principles.

section10.title: 10. Dispute Resolution
section10.paragraph1: Any legal action of whatever nature brought by either you or us (collectively, the "Parties" and individually, a "Party") shall be commenced or prosecuted in the state and federal courts located in {cityJurisdiction}, {jurisdiction}, and the Parties hereby consent to, and waive all defenses of lack of personal jurisdiction and forum non conveniens with respect to venue and jurisdiction in such state and federal courts.

section11.title: 11. Disclaimer
section11.paragraph1: THE SERVICE IS PROVIDED ON AN AS-IS AND AS-AVAILABLE BASIS. YOU AGREE THAT YOUR USE OF THE SERVICE WILL BE AT YOUR SOLE RISK. TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, WE DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, IN CONNECTION WITH THE SERVICE AND YOUR USE THEREOF, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND NON-INFRINGEMENT.

section12.title: 12. Limitation of Liability
section12.paragraph1: IN NO EVENT WILL WE OR OUR DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES, OR AGENTS BE LIABLE TO YOU OR ANY THIRD PARTY FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, CONSEQUENTIAL, EXEMPLARY, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, INCLUDING LOST PROFIT, LOST REVENUE, LOSS OF DATA, OR OTHER DAMAGES ARISING FROM YOUR USE OF THE SERVICE, EVEN IF WE HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.

section13.title: 13. Indemnification
section13.paragraph1: You agree to defend, indemnify, and hold us harmless, including our subsidiaries, affiliates, and all of our respective officers, agents, partners, and employees, from and against any loss, damage, liability, claim, or demand, including reasonable attorneys' fees and expenses, made by any third party due to or arising out of: (1) use of the Service; (2) breach of these Terms of Service; (3) any breach of your representations and warranties set forth in these Terms of Service; (4) your violation of the rights of a third party, including but not limited to intellectual property rights; or (5) any overt harmful act toward any other user of the Service with whom you connected via the Service.

section14.title: 14. Contact Us
section14.intro: In order to resolve a complaint regarding the Service or to receive further information regarding use of the Service, please contact us at:

section1.title: 1. Introduction
section1.paragraph1: This Cookie Policy explains how Theodora ("we", "us", and "our") uses cookies and similar technologies to recognize you when you visit our website at {websiteUrl} ("Website"). It explains what these technologies are and why we use them, as well as your rights to control our use of them.

section2.title: 2. What are cookies?
section2.paragraph1: Cookies are small data files that are placed on your computer or mobile device when you visit a website. Cookies are widely used by website owners in order to make their websites work, or to work more efficiently, as well as to provide reporting information.
section2.paragraph2: Cookies set by the website owner (in this case, Theodora) are called "first-party cookies". Cookies set by parties other than the website owner are called "third-party cookies". Third-party cookies enable third-party features or functionality to be provided on or through the website (e.g., advertising, interactive content, and analytics).

section3.title: 3. Why do we use cookies?
section3.intro: We use first-party and third-party cookies for several reasons. Some cookies are required for technical reasons in order for our Website to operate, and we refer to these as "essential" or "strictly necessary" cookies. Other cookies also enable us to track and target the interests of our users to enhance the experience on our Online Properties. Third parties serve cookies through our Website for advertising, analytics, and other purposes. This is described in more detail below:

item1.title: Essential Website Cookies:
item1.description: These cookies are strictly necessary to provide you with services available through our Website and to use some of its features, such as access to secure areas.

item2.title: Performance and Functionality Cookies:
item2.description: These cookies are used to enhance the performance and functionality of our Website but are non-essential to their use. However, without these cookies, certain functionality may become unavailable.

item3.title: Analytics and Customization Cookies:
item3.description: These cookies collect information that is used either in aggregate form to help us understand how our Website is being used or how effective our marketing campaigns are, or to help us customize our Website for you.

item4.title: Third-Party Cookies:
item4.description: We may partner with third-party companies to manage our advertising on other sites or to analyze site usage. These third parties may use cookies or similar technologies to gather information about your activities on this site and other sites in order to provide you advertising based upon your browsing activities and interests, or to analyze site usage.

section4.title: 4. How can you control cookies?
section4.paragraph1: You have the right to decide whether to accept or reject cookies. You can exercise your cookie rights by setting your preferences in your web browser.
section4.paragraph2: Most web browsers allow some control of most cookies through the browser settings. To find out more about cookies, including how to see what cookies have been set and how to manage and delete them, visit www.aboutcookies.org or www.allaboutcookies.org.
section4.paragraph3: You can usually find these settings in the 'options' or 'preferences' menu of your browser. To understand these settings, the following links may be helpful, or you can use the 'Help' option in your browser for more details:
section4.paragraph4: To opt out of being tracked by Google Analytics across all websites, visit http://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout.
section4.paragraph5: Please note that if you choose to reject cookies, you may still use our website, though your access to some functionality and areas of our website may be restricted.

section5.title: 5. Changes to this Cookie Policy
section5.paragraph1: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time in order to reflect, for example, changes to the cookies we use or for other operational, legal, or regulatory reasons. Please therefore re-visit this Cookie Policy regularly to stay informed about our use of cookies and related technologies.

section6.title: 6. Contact Us
section6.intro: If you have any questions about our use of cookies or other technologies, please email us at:
